body:
If you are seeing this screen, it means you are not connected to the Internet, and you may see delays when trying to send a message or download media. Connection issues can sometimes be due to poor cellular reception or a weak Wi-Fi signal. Please try the following:

  • Try to connect to any other network, preferably a reliable Wi-Fi network.
  • If you are on a cellular network, make sure that cellular data is turned on for WhatsApp in iPhone Settings > Cellular.
  • Power your phone off for 30 seconds and then power back on.
  • In iPhone Settings, Turn Airplane Mode ON then OFF.
  • Go to iPhone Settings > General > Reset > Reset Network Settings (This will delete all your saved Wi-Fi passwords, but usually fixes most connection issues).
  • Update or restore your iPhone's iOS to the latest version for your device.
  • Contact the system administrator of the network you are on, especially if you are on a campus or corporate Wi-Fi. WhatsApp is not designed to be used with proxy or VPN services.

Note: If you experience connection issues only on Wi-Fi or only on mobile data, this is likely caused by your mobile data provider or your Wi-Fi network and not WhatsApp. Please contact your service provider or network admin for more information.
title: Not Connected
